name: Ext.grid.filters.filter.List
doc:
The list grid filter allows you to create a filter selection that limits results to values matching an element in a list. The filter can be set programmatically or via user input with a configurable check box field in the filter section of the column header.

List filters are able to be preloaded/backed by an Ext.data.Store to load their options the first time they are shown. They are also able to create their own list of values from all unique values of the specified dataIndex field in the store at first time of filter invocation.

Example List Filter Usage:

var shows = Ext.create('Ext.data.Store', {
    fields: ['id','show','rating'],
    data: [
        {id: 0, show: 'Battlestar Galactica', rating: 2},
        {id: 1, show: 'Doctor Who', rating: 4},
        {id: 2, show: 'Farscape', rating: 3},
        {id: 3, show: 'Firefly', rating: 4},
        {id: 4, show: 'Star Trek', rating: 1},
        {id: 5, show: 'Star Wars: Christmas Special', rating: 5}
    ]
});

Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
    title: 'Sci-Fi Television',
    height: 250,
    width: 350,
    store: shows,
    plugins: 'gridfilters',
    columns: [{
        dataIndex: 'id',
        text: 'ID',
        width: 50
    },{
        dataIndex: 'show',
        text: 'Show',
        flex: 1                  
    },{
        dataIndex: 'rating',
        text: 'Rating',
        width: 75,
        filter: {
            type: 'list',
            value: 5                      
        }
    }]
});

Options

There are three means to determine the list of options to present to the user:

  • The options config.
  • The store config. In this mode, the idField and labelField configs are used to extract the presentation and filtering values from the store and apply to the menu items and grid store filter, respectively.
  • If none of the above is specified, the associated grid's store is used. In this case, the dataIndex is used to determine the filter values and the labelIndex is used to populate the menu items. These fields are extracted from the records in the associated grid's store. Both of these configs default to the column's dataIndex property.

In all of these modes, a store is created that is synchronized with the menu items. The records in this store have idField and labelField fields that get populated from which ever source was provided.

var filters = Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    ...
    columns: [{
        text: 'Size',
        dataIndex: 'size',

        filter: {
            type: 'list',
            // options will be used as data to implicitly creates an ArrayStore
            options: ['extra small', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'extra large']
        }
    }],
    ...
});

members.name: active
members.doc: Indicates the initial status of the filter (defaults to false).
members.short_doc: Indicates the initial status of the filter (defaults to false). ...

members.name: dataIndex
members.doc: The Ext.data.Store dataIndex of the field this filter represents. The dataIndex does not actually have to exist in the store.
members.short_doc: The Ext.data.Store dataIndex of the field this filter represents. ...

members.name: idField
members.doc: The field name for the id of records in this list's store. These values are used to populate the filter for the grid's store.
members.short_doc: The field name for the id of records in this list's store. ...

members.name: itemDefaults
members.doc:
See the documentation for the base class for details.

In the case of this class, however, note that the checked config should not be specified.
members.short_doc:
See the documentation for
the base class for details. ...

members.name: labelField
members.doc: The field name for the menu item text in the records in this list's store.
members.short_doc: The field name for the menu item text in the records in this list's store. ...

members.name: labelIndex
members.doc:
The field in the records of the grid's store from which the menu item text should be retrieved. This field is only used when no options and no store is provided and the distinct value of the grid's store need to be generated dynamically.

If not provided, this field defaults to the column's dataIndex property.
members.short_doc: The field in the records of the grid's store from which the menu item text should be retrieved. ...

members.name: loadOnShow
members.short_doc: Defaults to true. ...

members.name: loadingText
members.doc: The text that is displayed while the configured store is loading.
members.short_doc: The text that is displayed while the configured store is loading. ...

members.name: options
members.doc:
The data to be used to implicitly create a data store to back this list. This is used only when the data source is local. If the data for the list is remote, use the store config instead.

If neither store nor options is specified, then the choices list is automatically populated from all unique values of the specified dataIndex field in the store at first time of filter invocation.

Each item within the provided array may be in one of the following formats:

  • Array :

    options: [
    [11, 'extra small'],
    [18, 'small'],
    [22, 'medium'],
    [35, 'large'],
    [44, 'extra large']
]

  • Object :

    labelField: 'name', // override default of 'text'
options: [
    {id: 11, name:'extra small'},
    {id: 18, name:'small'},
    {id: 22, name:'medium'},
    {id: 35, name:'large'},
    {id: 44, name:'extra large'}
]

  • String :

    options: ['extra small', 'small', 'medium', 'large', 'extra large']
members.short_doc: The data to be used to implicitly create a data store to back this list. ...

members.name: single
members.doc: Specify true to group all items in this list into a single-select radio button group. Defaults to false.
members.short_doc:
Specify true to group all items in this list into a single-select
radio button group. ...

members.name: store
members.doc:
The Ext.data.Store this list should use as its data source.

If neither store nor options is specified, then the choices list is automatically populated from all unique values of the specified dataIndex field in the store at first time of filter invocation.
members.short_doc: The Ext.data.Store this list should use as its data source. ...

members.name: updateBuffer
members.doc: Number of milliseconds to wait after user interaction to fire an update. Only supported by filters: 'list', 'numeric', and 'string'.
members.short_doc: Number of milliseconds to wait after user interaction to fire an update. ...

members.name: active
members.doc: True if this filter is active. Use setActive() to alter after configuration. If you set a value, the filter will be actived automatically.
members.short_doc: True if this filter is active. ...

members.name: filterIdPrefix
members.doc: The prefix for id's used to track stateful Store filters.
members.short_doc: The prefix for id's used to track stateful Store filters. ...

members.name: menu
members.doc: The filter configuration menu that will be installed into the filter submenu of a column menu.

members.name: type
members.doc: The filter type. Used by the filters.Feature class when adding filters and applying state.
members.short_doc: The filter type. ...
